conclusion: The toy car A is entering from the lower-right with noticeable speed.
The first object in the car's path is the large blue-purple cube, and there is sufficient open space before the cube.
No earlier impact is expected before the blue-purple cube due to the open space.
Car A is heavier and lower than the wooden cubes, so on impact it will push the blue-purple cube forward rather than be stopped by it.
The blue-purple cube will slide a short distance toward the centre of the table.
After deflecting the blue-purple cube, the car’s heading will shift slightly to the left (toward the picture centre) and its speed will be reduced.
The next items in the car's path are the red cube and the nearby marble.
The car will have a second, lighter impact with the red cube, which removes more of the car’s remaining speed.
The marble, being spherical and nearly friction-less, will be ejected, but the resulting reaction force is small and does not stop the car.
After these collisions, the car’s velocity is now low, and friction with the felt surface becomes dominant.
The car drifts a short additional distance and rolls to rest roughly in the middle region shown just above the current marble position.
Final prediction: Car A will come to a stop near the centre of the image, a little above and left of the present marble location, after pushing the purple and red cubes and glancing off the marble.
